result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph P Ignacio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

No contact with victim listed in the criminal complaint.
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.
No use or possession of controlled substances without valid doctors prescription.
Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph P Ignacio

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Joseph P Ignacio in court with attorney Jamie J LaVora.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of guilty as to count # 2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count # 1 dismissed and read in.  
State makes recommendations as to sentencing.   Attorney LaVora makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements. 


The Court Orders the Following:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
90 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  


Term of Probation: 1 Years
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with victim listed in the criminal complaint.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctors prescription
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;




FINE or COSTS:  $343.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $200.00  to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph P Ignacio in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on March 31, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Paul S. Crawford in court.   Defendant Joseph P Ignacio did not appear.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization  Hearing scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Hearing at 02-15-2016 01:30 pm
